bugs.title: All golang versions prior to 1.9 do not support OIDs that require more than 28 bits

long_desc.thetext: golang-1.8.3-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8f018a3d39

bugs.title: CVE-2017-8932 golang: Elliptic curves carry propagation issue in x86-64 P-256

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-8932 golang: Elliptic curves carry propagation issue in x86-64 P-256

long_desc.thetext:
A carry propagation issue was found in the P-256 implementation for x86-64 in golang.

Upstream issue:

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/20040

Upstream patch:

https://golang.org/cl/41070

Created golang tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1455190]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1455191]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2017:1859 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:1859

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by jcajka.
This update has been pushed to testing.

jcajka edited this update.

This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has reached 7 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by jcajka.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
* Bump to 1.8.3
* Security fix for CVE-2017-8932
* add support for 28+bit OIDs in asn1
